intro: Colysis ovata, commonly known as the oval colysis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The botanical features of Colysis ovata make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
